May 6-7, 2025

Station F, Paris

Register Now
Back to Home

The Open for SDG Conference features a comprehensive two-day program bringing together thought leaders, practitioners, and innovators. Each thematic session begins with expert presentations followed by interactive panel discussions, fostering meaningful dialogue on how open technologies can accelerate progress toward the Sustainable Development Goals.

Day 1 - May 6, 2025

  • 001

    Opening Keynote Session

    • 09:00–09:15: Welcome Address by Tiejun Huang (Chairman, BAAI)
    • 09:15–09:45: Keynote by Mehdi Snene (Chief AI Officer, OECD & UN)
    The opening session sets the stage for two days of exploration into how open technologies can drive sustainable development globally.

  • 002

    Open Data for the SDGs

    • 09:45–10:05: Case Study: Data for Public Healthcare
    • 10:05–10:50: Panel Discussion
    Moderator: Yonghua Lin (BAAI) Panelists: M.O. KHAH (UN Data Governance), Yong Qin (Nankai University) Exploring how open data initiatives can accelerate progress on health-related SDGs through improved data sharing and collaboration.

  • 003

    Open Policy for the SDGs

    • 10:50–11:10: Case Study: Open-Source Projects Aligned with SDGs
    • 11:10–11:55: Panel Discussion
    Moderator: Anni Lai (Generative AI Commons) Panelists: Gael Blondelle (Eclipse Foundation), Matt White (PyTorch Foundation) Discussing governance models, contribution pathways, and policy frameworks for UN engagement with open-source communities.

  • 004

    Open Science for the SDGs

    • 11:55–12:15: Presentation on OpenSeek & Open Compute
    • 12:15–13:00: Panel Discussion
    Speaker: Yonghua Lin (VP & Chief Engineer, BAAI) Panelists: Sameer Chauhan (UNICC), representatives from UNU Mexico, ITU, ASEAN Highlighting open science principles, identifying barriers and enablers, and shaping a roadmap for collaborative research.

Day 2 - May 7, 2025

  • 001

    Future AI for the SDGs

    • 09:00–09:20: Presentation: BrainU for Persons with Disabilities
    • 09:20–10:05: Panel Discussion
    Speaker: Bo Lei (BAAI / BrainCo China) Moderator: Hilary Carter (Linux Foundation Research) Panelists: Representatives from ITU, School of Government of South Africa, DeepSeek/Qwen/Baidu Envisioning how AI innovations can create inclusive solutions for sustainable development challenges.

  • 002

    Show & Tell Sessions

    • 10:05–10:15: Lightning Talk 1: Open-Source Healthcare Solutions
    • 10:15–10:25: Lightning Talk 2: Educational Technology for SDG 4
    • 10:25–10:35: Lightning Talk 3: Climate Data Platforms
    • 10:35–10:45: Lightning Talk 4: Financial Inclusion Tools
    Showcasing practical open-source projects and use cases that are actively supporting various SDGs.

  • 003

    Closing Session

    • 10:45–11:15: Synthesis and Key Takeaways
    • 11:15–11:30: Call to Action and Next Steps
    Summarizing insights from the conference and outlining concrete actions for advancing open collaboration for the SDGs.

Session Formats

Each session is designed to maximize engagement and knowledge sharing

Keynote Presentations

20-30 minute talks by leading experts setting the context for each thematic area

Panel Discussions

45-minute moderated discussions bringing diverse perspectives on critical topics

Lightning Talks

10-minute presentations showcasing real-world applications and success stories

Networking Breaks

Structured opportunities for participants to connect and explore collaborations

Keynote Speakers

Leading voices shaping the future of open collaboration for sustainable development

Conference Venue

Station F - Paris

5 Parvis Alan Turing, 75013 Paris, France

Join us at Station F, Europe's largest startup campus. This state-of-the-art facility provides the perfect environment for innovation, collaboration, and meaningful dialogue about the future of open technologies for sustainable development.

Ready to Join Us?

Space is limited for this exclusive gathering of open-source and sustainability leaders. Register now to secure your place at the Open for SDG Conference.
